Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: large, open kitchen

The kitchen is long and broad with high, smoke-blackened ceilings. A heavy swinging oak door leads to the main room of the tavern; a wide, shallow fireplace is set just east of the middle of the north wall. A massive preparation table dominates the center of the room. A small dressing table sits in the southeast corner. Wide wooden shelves and two small portraits hang on the west wall and a butter churn rests in the southwest corner.

A heavy swinging oak door leads to the main room of the tavern; a wide, shallow fireplace is set just east of the middle of the north wall. A massive preparation table dominates the center of the room. A small dressing table sits in the southeast corner. Wide wooden shelves and two small portraits hang on the west wall and a butter churn rests in the southwest corner.

The kitchen is long and broad with high, smoke-blackened ceilings. A heavy swinging oak door leads to the main room of the tavern; a wide, shallow fireplace is set just east of the middle of the north wall. A massive preparation table dominates the center of the room. A small dressing table sits in the southeast corner. Wide wooden shelves and two small portraits hang on the west wall and a butter churn rests in the southwest corner.
a swinging door leading north
A swinging door to the main room. $(parent-desc)
A swinging door to the main room. $(parent-desc)
You push through the heavy swinging door and enter the kitchen of The Copper Claw Tavern.
pushes {$(actor.base:possessive) |$(actor.base:possessive)} way through the heavy swinging door and arrives here.
pushes {$(actor.base:possessive) |$(actor.base:possessive)} way through the heavy swinging door and enters the main room of The Copper Claw Tavern.
storage baskets
Sturdy storage baskets containing utensils of various shapes and sizes and different sized pots and pans as well as charred baking baskets sit tidily on the shelves.
Sturdy storage baskets containing utensils of various shapes and sizes and different sized pots and pans as well as charred baking baskets sit tidily on the shelves.
a high, blackened ceiling
Thick, dark oak joists, sagging and uneven, cross the high, blackened ceiling about fifteen feet overhead. They support wide wooden planks, which have been plastered and whitewashed.
Wooden, sagging joists cross the high, dark ceiling about fifteen feet overhead. They support wide wooden planks.
Thick, dark oak joists, sagging and uneven, cross the high, blackened ceiling about fifteen feet overhead. They support wide wooden planks, which have been plastered and whitewashed.
Thick wooden joists, sagging and uneven, cross the blackened ceiling. They support wide wooden planks, which have been plastered and whitewashed.
A high, dark ceiling.
Wooden joists support wide, plastered and whitewashed planks of the high, blackened ceiling.
the chimney
The fieldstone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the northern wall to the ceiling. There is no mantel or shelf on the chimney.
The stone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the northern wall.
The stone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the northern wall to the ceiling.
tall butter churn
A serviceable, well used butter churn with a long smooth handle and a slatted, barrel base sits in the southwest corner of the room.
You can just make out the shape of a butter churn in the southwest corner of the room.
A serviceable, well used butter churn with a long smooth handle and a slatted, barrel base sits in the southwest corner of the room.
A tall, wooden butter churn rests in the southwest corner of the room.
A tall, wooden butter churn rests in the southwest corner of the room.
You see a tall narrow shape in the southwest corner of the room.
a butter churn sits in the southwest corner of the room.
the fire
A cheerful fire is burning on a few logs within the hearth.
A cheerful fire is barely burning on a few logs within the hearth.
A cheerful fire is burning dimly on a few logs within the hearth.
a hardwood floor
The floor is made from smooth oak planks, of various widths. The planks are now seamless for even stepping.
The floor is made from smooth oak planks, of various widths. The planks are now seamless for even stepping.
The floor is made from smooth oak planks, of various widths. The planks are now seamless for even stepping.
The floor is made from smooth oak planks, of various widths. The planks are now seamless for even stepping.
A dark, wood floor.
The floor is made from smooth oak planks, of various widths. The planks are now seamless for even stepping.
a heavy iron hook
Two sturdy iron bars extend from the western wall of the hearth to join and support a large, heavy, charred iron hook from which can be hung various pots and cookware.
A heavy, iron hook protrudes from the western side of the fireplace and over the center of the fire.
NEW detail
two small paintings

Hanging unobtrusively on the western wall are two small oil paintings in gilded frames, the first of three small foxes playing together in front of a cheerful fire and the other of a mother fox holding her kit close in a large wooden rocking chair.
Two small oil paintings of three young foxes playing with toys near a cheerful fire and a mother fox gently rocking her kit hang on the western wall.
storage shelves
Wide, storage shelves, mounted on the western wall, are laden with baskets of utensils of every shape and size, pots and pans and baking baskets.
You see shelving on the west wall.
Storage shelves, mounted on the western wall, are laden with baskets of utensils of every shape and size, pots, pans and baking baskets.
massive wooden preparation table

A massive, wooden preparation table is in the center of the room, taking up most of the space. The table has seen heavy use and has been worn smooth from frequent scrubbing. Multiple fox tails have been carved into each of the four legs.
A massive wooden preparation table.
A heavy, wooden preparation table sits in the center of the room.
long, narrow dressing table

A long, narrow wooden dressing table is in the southeast corner of the room. It seems that this is where the prepared food is dressed and garnished before they are brought to the customers, for it is less worn than the other tables.
A long, narrow wooden dressing table is in the southeast corner of the room.
the eastern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered eastern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about 15 feet high. Storage shelves and two small paintings hang on the eastern wall.
The half-timbered eastern wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster.

The close-studded, half-timbered eastern wall of this dim room is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. Storage shelves and two small paintings hang on the eastern wall.

The close-studded, half-timbered eastern wall is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square - not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. Storage shelves and two small paintings hang on the eastern wall.
The eastern side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster.

The half-timbered eastern wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. Storage shelves and two small paintings hang on the eastern wall.
the northern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high. A fireplace is set just east of the middle of the wall. A door stands in the western end of this wall.

The half-timbered northern wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster. There seems to be a fireplace set in the wall east of the door.

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall of this dim room is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. There is a fireplace near the middle of the wall and a door to its left.

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. A swinging door stands to the left and a fireplace is set near the middle.
The northern side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster with a door.

The half-timbered northern wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. There is a fireplace set in the wall and a door to its left.
the southern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered southern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high.
The half-timbered southern wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster.

Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster.

The southern side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster.
The half-timbered southern wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster.
the western wall

The close-studded, half-timbered western wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high. Wide wooden shelves and two small portraits adorn this wall.

The half-timbered western wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster. Shelves and pictures hang on this wall.

Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. Wide wooden shelves and two small portraits adorn this wall.

Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. Wide wooden shelves and two small portraits adorn this wall.
The western side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster. Shelves and pictures hang on this wall.
